meanings.definition: The action of removing leaves from a plant or tree.
meanings.sent1: Defoliation can help prevent the spread of diseases in plants.
meanings.sent2: In autumn, the defoliation of trees creates a beautiful carpet of leaves on the ground.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel caused defoliation by nibbling on all the leaves of the young sapling.
meanings.sent4: The defoliation of the forest was a stark reminder of the impact of the harsh winter.
meanings.sent5: The sudden defoliation of the cherry blossom tree left a bare and stark silhouette against the sky.

meanings.definition: The process of shedding leaves, especially as a natural part of growth or seasonal change.
meanings.sent1: The defoliation of the deciduous tree signaled the arrival of winter.
meanings.sent2: During autumn, defoliation is a common sight as trees prepare for the colder months.
meanings.sent3: The defoliation of the maple tree was like a graceful dance of falling leaves.
meanings.sent4: The defoliation of the forest in fall painted a vibrant carpet of reds and golds.
meanings.sent5: The defoliation of the oak tree revealed the intricate patterns of its branches against the sky.
